--- In gladiator@yahoogroups.com, "alternate_dph" <dph_of_rules@u...>
wrote:
> 
> Easy, in one of my scenarios, where you rescue the God of the
Undead,
> he is much weaker in his 1st appearance than in his next
appearance. 
> Why?  Plotwise, the presence of runes (aka towers) was making him
> weak.  Anyways, you really should defeat every scenario to go to the
> next one. Maybe have the grunts of the 2 armies fight each other
with
> a weak sub-commander would help.

*frowns*, but making everyone beatable would ruin the current plot. 
It wouldn't be hard to make everyone beatable, but on Nylwin Town you
can leave the level at any time (even without beating every enemy);
I'd like my level to be like that.  I used deathifier's GladScenConv
program (great prog BTW) and saw entries like "Scenario Type: 0 (Kill
all Monsters)" and "Scenario Type: 2 (Must kill generators)".  What's
the line of code to use to make it "leavable anytime" so I can use
GladScenConv (again really nice prog thanks deathifier) for
converstion purposes?
